page.title: 11THE COMMUNITY OF HORWICH (2)
page.content: At least the Metropolitan Borough, through its planning department, had a close look at the old town centre of Horwich near the Crown. They have tried to limit housing development on the fringes of the countryside and done everything to encourage new housing in the vacant sites of the centre. In addition, these new housing units are of a varied, reasonably cheaply built type, aiming to meet the needs of local people. The centre is coming alive again. Issues which Horwich still needs to consider are the problem of traffic flow on Lee Lane, the provision of a wide range of smart shops and above all the employment of young people whose lives markedly changed when the kernel of the old Horwich, the Locomotive Works, closed in 1984.
